root: ^You are on your way to an important meeting when you realize that you've lost your house key.

SearchPockets: ^You frantically search through your pockets and bag, but you can't find your key.
^Ask a passerby if they've seen your key
RetraceSteps: ^You re-trace your steps, scanning the ground for any sign of your key.
^Ask a shop owner if they've seen your key
AskPasserby: ^You approach a passerby and ask if they've seen your key. They haven't, but they offer to help you look for it.
AskShopOwner: ^You enter a nearby shop and ask the owner if they've seen your key. They haven't, but they offer to keep an eye out for it.
^Thank the shop owner and continue your search
CheckTrashCans: ^You rummage through nearby trash cans, hoping to find your key.
AcceptHelp: ^You and the passerby search for your key together and eventually find it hidden in a nearby bush. You feel grateful for their help and thank them before continuing on your way.
DeclineHelp: ^You continue searching for your key alone, but you can't find it. Eventually, you give up and go back home.
ContinueSearch: ^You continue searching for your key, checking every nook and cranny until you finally find it. You feel a sense of relief and joy as you head to your important meeting.
GiveUp: ^You give up on finding your key and go back home, feeling frustrated and disappointed.
FindKey: ^You're thrilled to have found your key and head to your important meeting feeling relieved and happy.
NoKey: ^You don't find your key and have to call a locksmith to let you into your house.
